channel.title: Extending twice?
channel.description:
Problem: You know the line [code]public class client extends Player implements Runnable {[/code] right? well right now its extending Player, but what if i want to extend two things? Player AND Thread?
Server Base: Project 16V4.5
If it isn't possible, then what is the function for a "pause" in java, like wait for a certain amount of time, i know this is one, i think: sleep(1000)
but i need to have a function that doesn't involve thread[br][size=1]Posted at: December 15, 2006, 12:10:19 AM[/size][hr]quick...

item.title: Extending twice?
item.dc:creator: @Sephiroth1 Sephiroth~
item.description:
@Sephiroth1 wrote:

synchronized(this){ try{ wait(/**/) }catch(InterruptedException E){ //System.out.println("I GOT INTTERUPTED!!!!"); } }

you missed out a ; after the wait

it works, however it waits first before doing anything else, i’ve tried re-ordering it, doesn’t work, making a seperate void, doesn’t work

Read full topic

item.title: Extending twice?
item.dc:creator: @Sephiroth1 Sephiroth~
item.description:
@Sephiroth1 wrote:

client.java:12928: unreported exception java.lang.InterruptedException; must be caught or declared to be thrown wait(5000); ^

this error

Read full topic

item.title: Extending twice?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

synchronized(this){ wait(/* Enter a number that represents the milliseconds*/); }

Note: if you don’t put synchronized(this) in there, you automatically get an IllegalMonitorStateException.

Read full topic
